sub_topic: De Rham cohomology and its applications
message_1: Let $M$ be a smooth connected surface with genus $g=2$, and let $\omega$ be a $2$-form on $M$ given by $\omega = x \, dy \wedge dz + y \, dx \wedge dz + z \, dx \wedge dy$. Calculate the second de Rham cohomology group of $M$ with coefficients in $\mathbb{R}$, i.e., $H_{\text{dR}}^2(M;\mathbb{R})$.
message_2:
To compute the second de Rham cohomology group of $M$, we will use the fact that the de Rham cohomology groups of a smooth manifold are isomorphic to the singular cohomology groups with real coefficients. In particular, we have $H_{\text{dR}}^2(M;\mathbb{R}) \cong H^2(M;\mathbb{R})$.

For a surface of genus $g=2$, we know that it is a closed orientable surface, and its singular cohomology groups can be computed using the following formula:

$H^k(M;\mathbb{R}) = \begin{cases}
\mathbb{R} & \text{if } k=0, \\
\mathbb{R}^{2g} & \text{if } k=1, \\
\mathbb{R} & \text{if } k=2, \\
0 & \text{otherwise}.
\end{cases}$

In our case, we are interested in the second cohomology group, so we have:

$H_{\text{dR}}^2(M;\mathbb{R}) \cong H^2(M;\mathbb{R}) = \mathbb{R}$.

Thus, the second de Rham cohomology group of $M$ with coefficients in $\mathbb{R}$ is isomorphic to $\mathbb{R}$.
